programme.title: My Pet My Angel
programme.desc: After leaving her boyfriend, veterinary surgeon Kam Wai-ting (Lam Ha Mei) moves to Sai Kung with her beloved dog Donut and starts a new life. At her new workplace, Wai-ting meets animal communicator Wong Sing-yan (Chow Ka Lok). The duo often quarrel due to their different values regarding pets. In an accident, Sing-yan acquires skills for communicating with Donut, and a man and a dog gradually build a friendship and help each other. Sing-yan learns from Donut that Wai-ting has some love issues, so he helps her decipher her conundrum. The duo's relationship improves, and they gradually like each other. However, they do not have feelings of affection due to their age difference. Donut wants to play matchmaker for the duo, but it gets into hilarious situations. And its ideas even backfire. Each of the duo also has their own admirers, resulting in more obstacles in their relationship.

programme.title: A Perfect Man
programme.desc: Yeung Yat-cheng (Joe Ma) has a good reputation in the realm of personal security. He is invited by his buddy Ha Chung-chau (Tsui Wing) to join a security company that is tasked with protecting a tycoon called Tseung Ding-tin (KK Cheung). While starting his new job, Yat-cheung is faced with personnel issues. Meanwhile, due to his unhappy childhood, Yat-cheng does not believe in marriage. However, he happens to hook up with Yau Chi-ching (Ali Lee). And Chi-ching then even starts working for the security company. Yat-cheng gradually has affectionate feelings for her. But the couple's relationship has to overcome certain hurdles. Moreover, problems keep cropping up as Ding-tin's son Cheuk-ting and his buddy Miu Shing-lam (Ricco Ng) secretly return to Hong Kong. Shing-lam even keeps picking on Yat-cheng. While Yat-cheng and Chi-ching's relationship gradually improves, Yat-cheng suspects Chi-ching has some ulterior motive as he somehow discovers her secret. The couple's relationship is on the verge of breaking up.

Mak Ling Ling first traveled to Shanghai with Ho Yi Ting, Lin Kaien, Ho Pei Jia, and Liu Xiao Kun, then joined Wu Ruoxi, Dai Zuyi, and You Jiaxin to explore Shenzhen and Guangzhou. programme.title: Exorcist's 2nd Meter, The
programme.desc: Taxi driver Ma Kwai (Kenneth Ma) goes down the road to exorcism as he is destined to perpetuate the legacy of genie Shek Kam-dong. He is also reunited with the mature soul of his buddy Mok Wai-ho (Hubert Wu). He even encounters Sze Loi-sze (Gloria Tang) and his younger brother Sze Lo-sze, who are both exorcists. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's West Coast is like nowhere else on Earth. From glacier-covered mountains to rain-drenched native forests to rough frigid seas, the landscape defies belief. Isolated from the rest of the world, this strip of almost untouched wilderness hides a host of endemic animals. Evolutionary castaways, every one of them is a rare ecological jewel. From alpine parrots and shy penguins to mammal-like kiwis and ancient eels. To survive the conditions the wildlife here has to be hardy, cunning and resourceful. A journey along the West Coast reveals the beauty of this land, and the trials and tribulations of the wildlife that live here.

programme.title: Homeland Guardian
programme.desc: Hong Kong police officer Ho Ho-fai, together with his mentor Huo Qiquan and junior Chen Yaoyang, have solved numerous major cases, earning the nickname "The Three Tigers of O Division." However, during a raid to capture the ruthless criminal Zhou Xiong, they suffer a crushing defeatâ€”Huo Qiquan is killed, Zhou Xiong escapes, and a video of Ho Ho-fai kneeling to Zhou Xiong in an attempt to save his mentor goes viral online. Due to this incident, O Division's senior official Shao Feng's promotion is delayed, and overnight, Ho Ho-fai becomes the disgrace of the police force. Nevertheless, he does not give up and is determined to uncover the truth and avenge his mentor. At this time, his wife Cai Zhuoxin, who has been separated from him for a year, returns to Hong Kong from Canada with their son. Ho Ho-fai tries hard to win her back, but Cai Zhuoxin remains indifferent. Just as Ho Ho-fai suspected, Zhou Xiong's mastermindâ€”Louis from the EGM Fund in the United Statesâ€”is plotting an unprecedented financial attack on Hong Kong, aiming to disrupt the prosperity and stability of the international financial center. His evil plan is accidentally discovered by American hacker Gordon and Gordon's girlfriend Li Ke'er. To protect her hometown of Hong Kong, Li Ke'er mails a USB drive containing the EGM financial attack plan to Hong Kong, but is killed for her actions. Gordon rushes to Hong Kong to find the USB drive, while Louis sends his subordinate Anna to hunt him down.

programme.title: Exorcist's 2nd Meter, The
programme.desc: Taxi driver Ma Kwai (Kenneth Ma) goes down the road to exorcism as he is destined to perpetuate the legacy of genie Shek Kam-dong. He is also reunited with the mature soul of his buddy Mok Wai-ho (Hubert Wu). He even encounters Sze Loi-sze (Gloria Tang) and his younger brother Sze Lo-sze, who are both exorcists. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's West Coast is like nowhere else on Earth. From glacier-covered mountains to rain-drenched native forests to rough frigid seas, the landscape defies belief. Isolated from the rest of the world, this strip of almost untouched wilderness hides a host of endemic animals. Evolutionary castaways, every one of them is a rare ecological jewel. From alpine parrots and shy penguins to mammal-like kiwis and ancient eels. To survive the conditions the wildlife here has to be hardy, cunning and resourceful. A journey along the West Coast reveals the beauty of this land, and the trials and tribulations of the wildlife that live here.

Each episode introduces a great book, opening up scientific texts, historical literature, novels, and even fashion magazines to share interesting knowledge discovered within the pages. programme.desc: " Big Boys Club" is a youth talk show hosted by a group of close friendsâ€”Bob Lam, Oscar Leung, Derek Wong, Philip Fan, and Alan Chan. Matters of love, relationships, and even same-sex relationships are endlessly discussed topics for men and women alike. programme.title: Exorcist's 2nd Meter, The

However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

He is invited by his buddy Ha Chung-chau (Tsui Wing) to join a security company that is tasked with protecting a tycoon called Tseung Ding-tin (KK Cheung). While starting his new job, Yat-cheung is faced with personnel issues. Meanwhile, due to his unhappy childhood, Yat-cheng does not believe in marriage. However, he happens to hook up with Yau Chi-ching (Ali Lee). And Chi-ching then even starts working for the security company. Yat-cheng gradually has affectionate feelings for her. But the couple's relationship has to overcome certain hurdles. Moreover, problems keep cropping up as Ding-tin's son Cheuk-ting and his buddy Miu Shing-lam (Ricco Ng) secretly return to Hong Kong. Shing-lam even keeps picking on Yat-cheng. While Yat-cheng and Chi-ching's relationship gradually improves, Yat-cheng suspects Chi-ching has some ulterior motive as he somehow discovers her secret. programme.desc: Hong Kong police officer Ho Ho-fai, together with his mentor Huo Qiquan and junior Chen Yaoyang, have solved numerous major cases, earning the nickname "The Three Tigers of O Division." However, during a raid to capture the ruthless criminal Zhou Xiong, they suffer a crushing defeatâ€”Huo Qiquan is killed, Zhou Xiong escapes, and a video of Ho Ho-fai kneeling to Zhou Xiong in an attempt to save his mentor goes viral online. Due to this incident, O Division's senior official Shao Feng's promotion is delayed, and overnight, Ho Ho-fai becomes the disgrace of the police force. Nevertheless, he does not give up and is determined to uncover the truth and avenge his mentor. At this time, his wife Cai Zhuoxin, who has been separated from him for a year, returns to Hong Kong from Canada with their son. Ho Ho-fai tries hard to win her back, but Cai Zhuoxin remains indifferent. Just as Ho Ho-fai suspected, Zhou Xiong's mastermindâ€”Louis from the EGM Fund in the United Statesâ€”is plotting an unprecedented financial attack on Hong Kong, aiming to disrupt the prosperity and stability of the international financial center. His evil plan is accidentally discovered by American hacker Gordon and Gordon's girlfriend Li Ke'er. To protect her hometown of Hong Kong, Li Ke'er mails a USB drive containing the EGM financial attack plan to Hong Kong, but is killed for her actions. Gordon rushes to Hong Kong to find the USB drive, while Louis sends his subordinate Anna to hunt him down.

Dia berkongsi kisah hidupnya yang luar biasa, menentang norma masyarakat demi mengejar impian dalam tarian Bharatanatyam. Dilahirkan dalam keluarga di mana seni tarian Bharatanatyam tidak digalakkan. Sanjay dipengaruhi oleh bapa saudaranya yang merupakan seorang penari Bharatanatyam yang gagal mencapai impiannya sebagai seorang yang berjaya dalam kehidupan. Sanjay berusaha mengubah persepsi keluarganya. Setelah tamat pengajian, Sanjay berusaha meyakinkan keluarga dan kekasihnya untuk menyokong impiannya terhadap Barathanatyam. Walaupun di tentang oleh keluarga dan kekasihnya, Sanjay mendapat sokongan dari Profesor Sulaiman, seorang mentor dari latar belakang agama dan budaya yang berbeza. Dia memberikan wang tunai dan tiket tersebut kepada Pak Karim, yang pada mulanya keberatan untuk menerimanya kerana bimbang meninggalkan ayam kesayangannya. programme.title: The Exorcist's 2nd Meter
programme.desc: Taxi driver Ma Kwai (Kenneth Ma) goes down the road to exorcism as he is destined to perpetuate the legacy of genie Shek Kam-dong. He is also reunited with the mature soul of his buddy Mok Wai-ho (Hubert Wu). He even encounters Sze Loi-sze (Gloria Tang) and his younger brother Sze Lo-sze, who are both exorcists. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's West Coast is like nowhere else on Earth. From glacier-covered mountains to rain-drenched native forests to rough frigid seas, the landscape defies belief. Isolated from the rest of the world, this strip of almost untouched wilderness hides a host of endemic animals. Evolutionary castaways, every one of them is a rare ecological jewel. From alpine parrots and shy penguins to mammal-like kiwis and ancient eels. To survive the conditions the wildlife here has to be hardy, cunning and resourceful. A journey along the West Coast reveals the beauty of this land, and the trials and tribulations of the wildlife that live here.

Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

programme.title: Homeland Guardian & What's On Today
programme.desc: Hong Kong police officer Ho Ho-fai, together with his mentor Huo Qiquan and junior Chen Yaoyang, have solved numerous major cases, earning the nickname "The Three Tigers of O Division." However, during a raid to capture the ruthless criminal Zhou Xiong, they suffer a crushing defeatâ€”Huo Qiquan is killed, Zhou Xiong escapes, and a video of Ho Ho-fai kneeling to Zhou Xiong in an attempt to save his mentor goes viral online. Due to this incident, O Division's senior official Shao Feng's promotion is delayed, and overnight, Ho Ho-fai becomes the disgrace of the police force. Nevertheless, he does not give up and is determined to uncover the truth and avenge his mentor. At this time, his wife Cai Zhuoxin, who has been separated from him for a year, returns to Hong Kong from Canada with their son. Ho Ho-fai tries hard to win her back, but Cai Zhuoxin remains indifferent. Just as Ho Ho-fai suspected, Zhou Xiong's mastermindâ€”Louis from the EGM Fund in the United Statesâ€”is plotting an unprecedented financial attack on Hong Kong, aiming to disrupt the prosperity and stability of the international financial center. His evil plan is accidentally discovered by American hacker Gordon and Gordon's girlfriend Li Ke'er. To protect her hometown of Hong Kong, Li Ke'er mails a USB drive containing the EGM financial attack plan to Hong Kong, but is killed for her actions. Gordon rushes to Hong Kong to find the USB drive, while Louis sends his subordinate Anna to hunt him down.

While starting his new job, Yat-cheung is faced with personnel issues. Meanwhile, due to his unhappy childhood, Yat-cheng does not believe in marriage. However, he happens to hook up with Yau Chi-ching (Ali Lee). And Chi-ching then even starts working for the security company. Yat-cheng gradually has affectionate feelings for her. But the couple's relationship has to overcome certain hurdles. Moreover, problems keep cropping up as Ding-tin's son Cheuk-ting and his buddy Miu Shing-lam (Ricco Ng) secretly return to Hong Kong. Shing-lam even keeps picking on Yat-cheng. While Yat-cheng and Chi-ching's relationship gradually improves, Yat-cheng suspects Chi-ching has some ulterior motive as he somehow discovers her secret. He is also reunited with the mature soul of his buddy Mok Wai-ho (Hubert Wu). He even encounters Sze Loi-sze (Gloria Tang) and his younger brother Sze Lo-sze, who are both exorcists. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's West Coast is like nowhere else on Earth. From glacier-covered mountains to rain-drenched native forests to rough frigid seas, the landscape defies belief. Isolated from the rest of the world, this strip of almost untouched wilderness hides a host of endemic animals. Evolutionary castaways, every one of them is a rare ecological jewel. From alpine parrots and shy penguins to mammal-like kiwis and ancient eels. To survive the conditions the wildlife here has to be hardy, cunning and resourceful. A journey along the West Coast reveals the beauty of this land, and the trials and tribulations of the wildlife that live here.

programme.desc: Renovation contractor KWAN KA-ON (Miu Kiu Wai) is the elder of four siblings, while his wife SZE LONG-KIU (Sonija Kwok) is a typical housewife. Buying a house is their longtime dream. But when his eldest brother, KWAN KA-HONG's business goes under, they shelve their plan to help him overcome his difficulties. KIU has to look for a job too. Unwilling to see ON shoulder the burden on his own, KWAN KA-LOK (Linda Chung), the third of the siblings, turns to her supervisor GAO WANG-CHIM (Michael Tse) for assistance, resulting in her taking part in an indecent proposal. Her boyfriend, TING KOON-FUNG (Ron Ng), breaks up angrily with her when he finds out about their affair. KWAN KA-WING (Him Law), the youngest of the four, prefers spending to saving and decides that he will in no circumstances help in the service of the mortgage. programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's West Coast is like nowhere else on Earth. From glacier-covered mountains to rain-drenched native forests to rough frigid seas, the landscape defies belief. Isolated from the rest of the world, this strip of almost untouched wilderness hides a host of endemic animals. Evolutionary castaways, every one of them is a rare ecological jewel. From alpine parrots and shy penguins to mammal-like kiwis and ancient eels. To survive the conditions the wildlife here has to be hardy, cunning and resourceful. A journey along the West Coast reveals the beauty of this land, and the trials and tribulations of the wildlife that live here.
